Looks to be a pretty standard out of memory crash. There isn't a huge amount that you can really do, but if you're looking to eliminate as many crashes as possible, I'd recommend you give Active Texture Management a try, and run the x32 version -- the x64 version is too buggy at present for it to really make use of the higher memory ceiling anyway.

Just a random x64 crash. Nothing can be done with it at the moment, at least until 0.25 (and probably the next several updates after that)

As vexx32 said, use x86 and ATM. I also recommend trying to run in OpenGL mode.
